snippet: The Labor Department said that in contrast to March’s slowdown, new claims rose less than expected last week and a moving average of claims fell.
abstract: Labor Department reports initial claims for state unemployment benefits rose 14,000 to seasonally adjusted 281,000 for week ended April 4.
lead_paragraph: The Labor Department said that in contrast to March’s slowdown, new claims rose less than expected last week and a moving average of claims fell.

headline.main: Unemployment Figures Contradict Signs of March Weakness
headline.print_headline: Jobless Claims Rise Less Than Expected, Suggesting a March Slowdown Isn’t Lasting
